title: Change in kinetic energy of two sphere system

content.question: Sphere <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and sphere <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></math> of mass <math alttext="2 m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> hang from light strings. Sphere <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> is pulled back, as shown above, and released from rest. Sphere <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> has kinetic energy <math alttext="K sub i" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math> immediately before colliding with sphere <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></math>. The two spheres stick together and move horizontally for an instant after the collision. During the collision, what is the change in the kinetic energy <math alttext="delta K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mtext></mtext><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the two-sphere system?
